body.p: The Tiruppukaḻ is a collection of hymns in honour of Murukaṉ by Aruṇakirinātar (15th century).
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1.
U2a: 1 folio, unfoliated = preface (Ciṟappuppāyiram in print editions), by hand n° 2. 5 lines per page.
U2b: 69 folios, Tamil foliation 1‒69 = text (mūlam), by hand n° 2. 5 to 6 lines per page.
U3: 1 folio, unfoliated = colophon, by hand n° 3 (?). 3 lines per page.
The bundle is complete. It contains 5 Pāyiram stanzas and 164 Tiruppukāls.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, preface folio (Ciṟappupāyiram), colophon.

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: marginal benediction; author and title.
(f[1]r, lm, 1–2) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f[1]r1–3) Aruṇakirinātar aruḷic ceyta tiruppukaḻ

U2a, folio 1, recto and verso, unfoliated = preface: marginal benedictions; 5 preface stanzas, benedictions.
(f[1]r, lm, 1) hari Om
(f[1]r, lm, 2) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r, lm, 3–4) kaṇapati cakāyam
(f[1]r1) Ellāru ñāṉat tiṉaiñarē keḷīrkēḷ ‡ kalletu māṇikkak kallāmō pollāk ‡ karuppukaḻaik kēṭkumō
(f[1]r2) kāṉamayil vīraṉ ‡ tiruppukaḻaik keḷīr tiṉam {pcs} tiruppukaḻ paṭikkumavar (…)
(f[1]v2) (…) {pcs} vētam-
(f[1]v3) vēṇ ṭāñcakala vittaivēṇ ṭāṅkīta ‡ nātamvēṇ ṭāmñāṉam vēṇṭā māti ‡ kuruppukaḻai mēvukiṉ(ṟa) koṟṟavaṉṟā-
(f[1]v4) ḷ pōṟṟun ‡ tiruppukaḻaik kēḷir tiṉam {pcs} civamayam {pcs} murukayyaṉ tuṇai {pcs} mātāpitākuruteyvan tuṇai {pcs}

U2b, folio 1, recto = incipit: marginal benedictions; stanza / Tiruppukaḻ n° 1.
(f1rlm) tevicakāyam vēlumayilun tuṇai civamayam.
(f1r1) kaittala niṟaiyaval muppaḻa moṭupori kappiya karimuka ṉaṭipēṇik ‡ kattiṭu [i.e. kaṟṟiṭu] maṭiyavar puttiyi (l)u[ṟai]pavar kaṟpa-
(f1r2) ka meṉaviṉai kaṭitēku ‡ mattamu matiyamum vaittiṭu maraṉmakaṉ maṟporu tiraḷpuya matayāṉai ‡ maṟṟaḷi [i.e. mattaḷa] vayiṟa-
(f1r3) ṉai yuṟṟami [i.e. yuttami] putalvaṉai maṭṭuṟu malarkoṭu paṇivēṉē ‡ muṟpaṭu kiritaṉil muttami ḻaṭaiviṉai muṟpaṭa veḻutiya mu-
(f1r4) talvōṉē ‡ muppura mericeyta vacciva ṉuṟaiva t(o)ccatu poṭiceyta vatitīrā ‡ vacc(ā)vaṇai varu cuppira maṇiyo-
(f1r5) ṭu vattuy(ara/ā)tutaṉai yatuvāki ‡ Acciṟu murukaṉai akkuṟa makaḷuṭaṉ Akkaṇa maṇamaruḷiya perumāḷē | 1 | (...)

U2b, folio 69, verso = excipit: stanza / Tiruppukaḻ n° 164.
(f69v3) (...) 163 {pcs} pūcal vantiṭu tōṭār kātoṭu mōti ṭuṅkayal māṉār māṉamali pōka maṅkaiyar kōṭā kōṭiyu matiṉālkaṟ ‡ pūra kuṅkuma
(f69v4) t(ū)ḷā yōtapa ṭīra ceṇpaka [i.e. caṇpaka] mālā lāḷita pūta raṅkaḷil mītē mūḻkiya Anurākam ‡ vācai yeṉkuṟa [i.e. yeṅkiṟa] pārā vāramum mēṟu kiṉṟila ṉāṉā pētamum Anēka
(f69v5) tantirakiṟiyāpē [i.e. tantirakiriyāvē] tamum Ākaman talaivāyār ‡ āḻi yumkarai kāṇē ṉ(a) vācakam piṟamaṉutānam pirai pāta paṅkaya mītē ṉākila ṉāyi ṉuṅkuru nātā [nī corrected to nā] nīyaruḷ purivāyē ‡
(f69v6) vāca vaṉpati pāḻā kāveṉ nīca taṅkulam vāḻā tēpaṭi māḷa vaṉkirikūṟāy nīṟeḻa neṭinēmi ‡ māta vaṉtiru vētā vōṭalai pōtu miṉkaṭal kōkō kōve
(f70r1) -ṉa vāy viṭum paṭi kū(ra)vē lēviyyi ḷaiyōṉē ‡ vīcu teṉṟalum veḷpū vāḷiyu mīṟu kiṉṟamai yāmo mokavi ṭāyke ṭumpaṭi cārāvākiya teṉa-
(f70r2) vēnal ‡ mītu ceṉṟuṟa vāṭā vēṭuvar p(o)ta koṅkaiyil mītē māluṟa vēṭai koṇṭapī [i.e. koṇṭapi] rāṉē vāṉavar perumāḷē {pcs} 164 {pcs}

(f[1]r2) c(ū)ṭiṉa puṟuvapaṭcattil vēṅkaṭācalan tirup-
(f[1]r3) pukaḻ tuvakkiyatu {pcl} civamay° {pcl} {pcs}

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
